results.title: The Holy Innocents = Los Santos Inocentes
results.creator_credit: Mario Camus, Julian Mateoas and Ganesh
results.brief_description: The Holy innocents is a poignant rural drama zeroing in on the abysmal class differences still existing in some sections of modern Spain, especially in the holdings of the rural aristocracy. The story concerns an impoverished family working on the estate of an aristocratic family in the province of Extramaduna in the 1960s. Each of the members of the poor family is spotlighted for a part of the film.

results.title: The City: cars or people?
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
A study of an old but dangerously growing problem - how to make the city accessible without allowing transport to make it congested and uninhabitable, as the private car now threatens.

results.title: The City: heaven and hell
results.creator_credit: Ian MacNeill and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Lewis Mumford on the city”.
An outline of the opposed natures - creative and destructive - of the city in history, the elements that created the first cities about 5000 years ago, and the forces that now threaten to destroy them.

results.title: The Hobbit
results.creator_credit: Arthur Rankin Jnr, Jules Bass and Rankin-Bass Productions
results.brief_description: Bilbo Baggins journeys into the Middle Earth, a place inhabited by Elves, dwarves, Wizards, Goblins, Dragons and Hobbits in an effort to reclaim the gold of the Dwarf King. It is an adventurous journey and a battle between the forces of Evil. This animated feature based on J.R.R. Tolkien’s timeless classic features the voices of John Huston (Gandalf the Grey), Otto Preminger (Elvenking) and Orson Bean (Bilbo Baggins).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Rankin Jnr, Jules Bass and Rankin-Bass Productions
results.description:
Bilbo Baggins journeys into Middle Earth, a place inhabited by elves, dwarves, wizards, goblins, dragons and hobbits, in an effort to reclaim the gold of the Dwarf King.

It’s an adventurous journey that features a battle between the forces of good and evil. This animated feature based on JRR Tolkien’s timeless classic features the voices of John Huston (Gandalf the Grey), Otto Preminger (Elvenking) and Orson Bean (Bilbo Baggins).

results.title: The History of pornography (E)
results.brief_description: This film documents the blazen and colourful history of pornography. It begins with primitive hard-core cave etchings, and the sublime prose and erotica of ancient China and India, progressing to the uncontrolled excesses of the Roman Empire and early European erotica. It also covers the first legalising of “porn” in Denmark, after a sexual revolution that challenged its constitutional laws. The rapid emergence of “dirty” comics and cartoons, and early underground “stag” films area also represented. The documentary finishes with an exploration of today’s mass marketing of sex.

results.title: The History of the Harley Davidson
results.creator_credit: Gary Legon, Sarah Legon and Estate Films
results.brief_description: The Harley-Davidson has legendary status. It has grown from cult appeal to mass appeal. Kids dream about them and grandparents own them. Harley is more than a motorcycle - it’s a state of mind. This program is both a history of the Harley-Davidson motorcycle and a visual feast containing fantastic shots of old, new and limited edition Harleys. Harley enthusiasts will revel in the adoration of their dream-machines, and those interested in the historical development of motor vehicles in society will be fascinated by this tribute to one of the main forms of transport. Harley loyalists run the gamut from celebrities, to librarians, to the guy down the street. Harley-Davidson will always stand for freedom, independence and the open road. Its place in history is assured. It remains, and will forever be a legend.

results.title: Something happened
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Healers quacks or mystics”.
Can supernatural forces be summoned at will to assist with human healing? In this episode Nevill Drury introduces us to spiritual healer, Rita McReady; the Assembly of God congregation in Mt. Gravatt, Qld, which conducts miracle services for sufferers each Sunday afternoon; the programs and philosophies practised at the Adventist Sanatorium Hospital in Sydney to mobilise the faith of patients to aid the healing process; the controversial Australian psychic surgeon, Chris Coles and finally the anointing and laying on of hands practised in a Sydney Anglican Church.

results.title: Mind the healer, mind the slayer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Healers quacks or mystics”.
At 24, vet and athlete, Ian Gawler was diagnosed with terminal bone cancer. After having one leg amputated, he was faced with only a few weeks to live. Determined to conquer his cancer, Ian embarked on a quest for an alternative cure for his illness. Now, many years later, his cancer arrested, he and his wife conduct meditation support groups for other cancer sufferers. This program follows Ian’s search and introduces us to the Melbourne pioneer of non-drug pain relief, Dr. Ainslie Meares, faith healing in the Philippines and Indian healing philosophies.

results.title: The Heart
results.creator_credit: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale, Mediacast, National Heart Foundation of Australia and Suatu Film Management
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Help yourself to health”.
The human heart is a remarkable pump, averaging 72 beats a minute, pumping 7,000 litres of blood every day. Medical specialists explain the anatomy and physiology of the heart, the roles played by its valves and chambers as well as the electrical system which regulates the contraction of the heart muscle.

results.title: Chi: the breath of life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Healers quacks or mystics”.
In this episode, Nevill Drury visits the Oki East-West Centre to investigate disciplines which draw on eastern thought and philosophy for new directions in health care. “Chi” is the Chinese word for breath of life, an inner energy. The Chinese believe it is the source of remarkable power, so the ability to control this energy is vital for a healthy and happy life. In a healthy person, the “Chi” flows smoothly, integrating body, mind and spirit, but in an unwell person there are blockages, or imbalances. The techniques demonstrated include Oki Yoga, Tai Chi, Shiatsu (with Bruce Gyngell as the patient), macrobiotics and acupuncture.
